pageTitle: Eggs Unlimited (release branch 3, updated Tue May 25 21:04:35 2010) - The Chicken Scheme wiki
textBeforeTable: Language extensions List of available eggs If you are looking for 3rd party libraries used by one the extensions, check out the CHICKEN tarball repository. If you would like to access the subversion repository, see eggs tutorial.  $ chicken-setup -help For more information, enter By default the archive will be unpacked into a temporary directory (named EXTENSIONNAME.egg-dir and the directory will be removed if the installation completed successfully. To keep the extracted files add -keep to the options passed to chicken-setup. $ chicken-setup -fetch EXTENSIONNAME  If you only want to download the extension and install it later, pass the -fetch option to chicken-setup:  $ chicken-setup -repository This will download anything needed to compile and install the library. If your extension repository is placed at a location for which you don't have write permissions, then run chicken-setup as root. You can obtain the repository location by running  $ chicken-setup EXTENSIONNAME Just enter Installation Note: the development of CHICKEN 3 is frozen. Consider using the current CHICKEN version and its corresponding eggs. A library of extensions for the Chicken Scheme system. Eggs Unlimited (release branch 3, updated Tue May 25 21:04:35 2010)     Unsupported or redundant Concurrency and parallelism Miscellaneous Macros and meta-syntax Code generation User interface toolkits Cryptography Unit-testing Sound Tools Data formats and parsing Algorithms and data-structures Object-oriented
